product_name: Mountain Equipment Matrix I Sleeping Bag
long_description: Built for backpackers who travel rain or shine, the Mountain Equipment Matrix I Sleeping Bag combines synthetic and down insulation for warmth down to about 35degF. Insulated with high-loft, water-resistant 725-fill-power duck down on top of the sleeping bag for warmth, light weight and compressibility. PrimaLoft(R) Synergy synthetic insulation on the bottom works a lot like down, but performs better than down when exposed to wet weather. With a lower-limit European Norm (EN) rating of 35degF, the Matrix I is a versatile bag for lightweight adventures into the mountains. Downproof and wind-resistant, the densely woven synthetic shell is lightweight, compressible and tough; silky soft lining is also downproof and highly breathable. Durable Water Repellent finish on shell causes water to bead up and roll off. 4-baffle trapezoid footbox is wide in toe area and narrow at the heels for comfort that does not compromise warmth. Protecting the head and neck, the hood features 5 baffles and an anatomic fit to provide warmth and low weight. Alpine Fit features a semi-tapered mummy profile with a tapered lower leg section to maximize warmth and minimize weight without restrictiveness. Single antisnag draft tube (along the 3/4 length zipper) and semi-floating neck collar drape comfortably, blocking the escape of heat and sealing out drafts. Mountain Equipment Matrix I sleeping bag comes with a lightweight stuff sack and mesh storage bag. European Norm (EN) is an independent third-party temperature rating, allowing accurate comparisons across brands with other EN-rated bags.
